title: Drawing, "Design for the Decoration of the Saloon, Royal Pavillion, Brighton", ca. 1815
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on white wove paper
markings:
Watermarks: 1948-40-25a: Read from verso, upside-down, center below upper edge: J WHATMAN /1815; 1948-40-25b: Read from verso, upside down: JWH/18
wove paper (kb)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
(a): Design of a section of south end of the circular room, showing the coved semicircular recess with doors. Window at right. The walls are hung with large panels of Chinese wallpaper of flowers and collaged birds, the base and mouldings are painted, as well as the columns at the entrance to the recess.

(b): Rendering of the Salon as it looked in 1802, with the hand-painted Chinese wallpaper and painted strip still in place as well as the painted fretwork on the ceiling, but without draperies at the windows.   A design for a new chandelier in the Chinese style is sketched in with pencil.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for the Decoration of the Saloon, Royal Pavillion, Brighton", ca. 1815.
ca. 1815. Brush and watercolor, graphite on white wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-25-a,b.
